availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, farmer and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Lucy W. James Keesee on January 6, 1848. Father of Ann M. Keesee, James C. Keesee, Houston L. Keesee Jr. Married to Elizabeth R. McCormick Keesee on October 6, 1856. Father of Elizabeth Keesee, Rufus Keesee, Birch Keesee, and William Keesee. Farmer in Union County in 1850 and 1860. Served in the 15th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as quarter-master sergeant and second lieutenant from August 14, 1862 to October 29, 1863. Served in the North Cumberland Battalion in the Kentucky State Militia as second lieutenant and captain from March 1, 1865 to August 28, 1865.
